question.title: What are the main complementary examinations other than imaging in the presence of a walking or balance disorder?
question.description: Depending on the aetiology EMG, biology...

option_a.title: Blood gas, PR (pulmonary embolism), and ECG: rhythm disorders
option_a.description: A combination of blood tests and electrocardiogram

option_b.title: Biological work-up (hypoglycaemia, ionic disorders: dyskalaemia, hypercalcaemia, hypocalcaemia, hyponatraemia, anaemia) and blood gas
option_b.description: A combination of blood tests and blood gas analysis

option_c.title: Injection-free brain scan: (subdural haematoma, extra-dural haematoma, stroke) and ECG: rhythm disorders
option_c.description: A combination of non-invasive brain scans and electrocardiogram

option_d.title: Biological work-up (hypoglycaemia, ionic disorders: dyskalaemia, hypercalcaemia, hypocalcaemia, hyponatraemia, anaemia) and injection-free brain scan: (subdural haematoma, extra-dural haematoma, stroke)
option_d.description: A combination of blood tests and non-invasive brain scans
